‚ÄúMaybe Everyone Is Right‚Ä¶ Or Maybe Not‚Äù

‚ù§Ô∏è Krishna Chaitanya January 21, 2024

Lost in a Snap

She just sent another snap. This time, with her friend Ramana.

They look like‚Ä¶ well, you know. And for a second, it hit me. Maybe I should just forget her. She‚Äôs happy. She‚Äôs moved on. Everything seems fine.

That was my first thought.

But then, I kept staring at that photo. Looking at them. At her smile. And suddenly, my mind switched again. She looks really happy. And I should move on.

But why do I feel like crying? Why does it hurt, but without tears?

Her smile‚Äîit‚Äôs so natural. The kind that makes everything around her shine. And yet, here I am, stuck. My brain just isn‚Äôt working.

What do I do now?

People around me are already saying, ‚ÄúBro, they‚Äôre definitely in love.‚Äù They think they know everything. But I thought I knew her. She never cared about love. Never once showed interest.

But now‚Ä¶ these things‚Ä¶ they‚Äôre starting to make sense. Maybe everyone is right.

Or maybe they‚Äôre just judging what they see.

Why do people always do that? Just look at something and decide the whole story?

Maybe, just maybe‚Äîbefore saying anything, we should think. Just once. Before judging.

There words are Just killing My soal

I know She Never Misuses Her freedom‚Ä¶
